5721e65c21b6.description: Fans of “Stranger Things” and “Alice and Wonderland” will love this serial novella by Joe Meno, author of “The Boy Detective Fails” and “Hairstyles of the Damned.” Shelley, a 19 year-old young woman, lives with her grandmother in a small southern town. One night, while listening to the police scanner, she learns that a local girl named Jamie has gone missing. Shelley, who was Jamie’s babysitter, sets out on her bike to search the woods where they used to play together. The missing girl is nowhere to be found, but she has left cryptic messages for Shelley that, over the course of the night, lead her to discover both the underappreciated virtues and sinister vices of the town’s residents. “Star Witness” is presented in seven parts by Electric Literature and its weekly fiction magazine, Recommended Reading, with illustrations by Alix Pentecost Farren.
5721e65c21b6.subtitle: A Story in Seven Parts
5721e65c21b6.title: Star Witness

e929e2517762.description: We’ve only begun to understand the step functions required to bring real time AI online. This collection by veteran AI watcher Azeem Azhar explores just how much, and how the massive compute requirements of AI will shift the entire technology industry in unexpected ways. Produced in partnership with shift.newco.co.
e929e2517762.subtitle: Paging the Valley: We’re going to need a lot more silicon.
e929e2517762.title: Artificial Intelligence and the Future of Computing
